message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.CE, cs.DS

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper discusses polar codes, which are a class of linear block codes that achieve channel capacity, and proposes techniques to improve their decoding performance. This falls under the scope of information theory.
2. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes techniques to improve the decoding performance of polar codes, which are used in wireless communication systems. This falls under the scope of systems and control.
3. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper discusses polar codes, which are used in wireless communication systems, and proposes techniques to improve their decoding performance. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
4. cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper proposes techniques to improve the decoding performance of polar codes, which involves computational methods and algorithms. This falls under the scope of computational engineering.
5. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper proposes techniques to improve the decoding performance of polar codes, which involves the design and analysis of algorithms. This falls under the scope of data structures and algorithms.
